snippet: “The Other America” had a simple thesis: poverty was both more extensive and more tenacious than an affluent America had assumed.
abstract: Op-Ed article by professor Maurice Isserman reflects upon America's last great socialist intellectual Michael Harrington, whose 1962 bestselling book The Other America: Poverty in the United States influenced the direction of social welfare policy at the time; argues that a compassionate voice like his is needed to counter the culturally determined arguments of contemporary thinkers like Charles Murray, who harshly depicts a white underclass in his latest book Coming Apart.
lead_paragraph: “The Other America” had a simple thesis: poverty was both more extensive and more tenacious than an affluent America had assumed.
